course.subject: LANG
course.name: Japanese Language and Related Culture
course.description: This is a course for learners with no previous knowledge of Japanese. It aims to offer students a foundation in Japanese language and related Japanese culture with an emphasis on practical oral communication. By the end of the course, students will be able to communicate appropriately in Japanese on a variety of everyday topics.

reviews.author: Cathleen
reviews.title: 早知drop...入嚟睇住班神仙互片
reviews.comment_content:
前期（add drop）：自製notes同ppt。

後期：大家的日本語1-6。
加上額外PPT單字。教好快，全部單詞講一次就完然後返去自己背啦。

第一二個星期就每日用幾個鍾抄同背假名同背單詞，終於叫勉強跟到。

但過完Quiz1覺得自己天真，個mean高到鬼噉...然後好多人滿分。
平時上堂扮唔識日文嘅學生唔會喺任何assessment同你手下留情。

根本至少半班入嚟讀之前就識日文，然後上堂扮唔識。最後quiz又個個神乎其技識嗮。
每個quiz個mean都係接近滿分。

最後一個起死回生嘅位就係culture presentation。塩見先生話全世界都係4-5/5。但呢度嘅一分等於quiz 10分。
reviews.comment_teaching:
佢人係好。但教得麻麻，飛太快。每個語法點只係講一次就當教完。
上堂就佢講一句你跟讀，自己讀得啱唔啱都唔知。

綜合嚟講我唔覺得係一個真正適合初學者嘅科。走去買本書聽錄音帶好過...

補充：
佢真係好有心，連啲quiz都逐個錯誤留comment畀你。每日6點起身返工（經常啲asm係一早就graded，6點起身覆email，quiz通常12點考完1點半就出嗮grade）email問問題都會好熱心回覆
reviews.comment_grading:
好多雜項，總之乜都要計分。quiz呀presentation呀participation呀...
我唔覺得會係一個好grade嘅科，根據教授所言，上個學期A Range cutoff係total 95%。好心噉嘅嘢就adddrop前通知聲讓我有機會drop啦。
（截止add drop後一個星期，學期尾出grade會再update）
更新：
日常mean 40+/50，highest就永遠係48-50/50啦（預咗），lowest 20-30+/50。
A range cutoff 係九成幾，意思係你只要每個quiz錯超過三題你就可以同A range無緣。

雖然B range好闊，冇乜C range
但極有可能無論你幾努力都唔會有A range。
reviews.comment_workload: 好大，超級忙碌。個個星期都有quiz同assignment，多嘢做。平日要背好多字。

reviews.author: LeekHA
reviews.title: 如果母語係中文既話，呢科唔會好難
reviews.comment_content:
課程包括《大家的日本語》一到六課。我唔清楚係咪今年網上上堂既原因，似乎教得唔係好多。內容只係好簡單既日常對話，雖然個course話學完可以同日本人做簡單交流，但係實際上去日本旅遊都係淨係識得指黎指去講this同that。

比較難既地方係一開始，要背五十音。背五十音其實唔難，但係要背得熟就係問題所在。我認為呢個就係成個course可以分高下的地方。所以如果要攞靚grade既話最好係開sem之前背好先。

但係留意一下，唔好學超過十個鐘。CLE對呢個course既beginner定義係學習日文時數等於或小過十個鐘。超過咗就冇得讀。

另外補充一點，呢個course叫做Japanese Language and Related Culture，所以你會接觸到所謂既related culture，而唔係單單學日文。不過唔會教好多，當聽下故仔咁都幾好。
reviews.comment_teaching:
呢個course既老師應該只係得一個。

如果從教學既態度黎睇，我覺得佢係呢個世界數一數二既好老師。佢既親和力係我見咁多個professor、tutor同teaching assistance之中最犀利既。上佢堂唔似係上堂，反而似係圍堆傾計咁，係爭在冇個爐可以圍埋一齊打邊爐咁話。佢講一句你讀一句，十足返到細細個同老師學英文咁，氣氛好極。

但係如果從教學水平黎睇，呢個係另一個極端。教五十音冇講咩叫濁音咩叫半濁音咩叫促音咩叫拗音，呢D全部係我係咁上網搵片睇先知有。基本上跟住佢咁學就等於完全死背。一個句式又唔分析個結構，就好似學英文唔同你講有SVO咁。如果你係為咗學好日文既話，老師就有如親身帶你行彎路。但係如果你係為咗攞一個好grade，咁其實佢既教得點對你冇咩影響，因為佢教既就等於係你會考到既。（但都係果句，好grade既前提係快人一步識五十音）
reviews.comment_grading:
呢個sem好特別，course既成個考核模式大改，所以我俾唔到D咩有價值的訊息。

呢個sem冇exam同midterm，全部拆分做21個quiz、6份assignment、一份presentation同5份culture note。差唔多每堂落堂就會叫大家做quiz。內容包含聽、說、讀、寫。

QUIZ：
quiz題種好豐富，問題可以係MC，可以係英譯日（單詞），難D既可以係對話填充。但D問題其實唔太難。正因為咁所以個個都好高分，所以我話五十音背得熟唔熟先至係分高下既地方。譬如話一個單詞有邊D位要用濁音，同埋留一下D連音現象等既各種小問題，呢D老師唔會教，會係你錯咗之後先至話番你知原來日文會有D咁既野。

ASSIGNMENT:
呢個sem有3份作文同3個speaking。其實speaking同作文既題目差唔多，好多時甚至可以直接讀個作文就得。而作文主要係叫你用幾句話介紹一D人或事，每份作文都係咁玩法，唯獨介紹既野唔同，而且只要你grammar冇錯，寫夠或講夠一定句數，小心D做基本上滿分。

PRESENTATION：
呢個係叫你做一個最少三分鐘介紹日本文化既presentation，老師expect你盡量用日文。而成個presentation既得分就係取決於你用幾多日文去present。當時老師並冇講到呢點，係我email過去問佢佢先咁講。所以就算你個present做得幾完美，但係都唔及一個全程用日語做演講既人高分。

CULTURE NOTE:
呢個我覺得冇咩好講，就純粹係每次老師介紹完一個culture之後寫返少少個人睇法。唔駛寫得好認真，老師講到明只要寫滿五行就有滿分。

總括而言，呢個course因為教既野唔深，所以大家既水平都係差唔多，如果可以多D同老師溝通，問清楚D細節，就可以勝在比其他人更了解個玩法。事實上就係好多人睇唔透老師到底係點樣評分，好似作文咁唔知要寫夠一定句數先有滿分，於是就有D輸蝕。此外，我覺得係quiz以外既地方係質同量作取捨既時候可以多側重量，而非質，呢個係我覺得同其他course比較大分別既地方。

*都係果句，呢個sem好特別，實際情況係點都係要上一兩堂先知。可能玩法會有D咩變，但都不外乎聽說讀寫。
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload一直都唔大。我覺得workload最大既時候得兩個地方，一係背五十音既時候，所以我再三話要盡早背。而另一個係準備presentation既時候。

我主要講下present既workload包括D咩。

首先，你要對日本文化熟悉，咁先至會有得做。所以你多多少少會花D時間去了解日本文化。其次，你要攞高分就要多包含日文，所以workload大唔大好取決於你打算擺幾多日文落份講稿度。我唔清楚講幾多日文會有幾多分，但我可以肯定你成份野全部係日文就一定滿分。而係大家分數咁接近既情況下，每一分都至關重要。所以workload大唔大都係見仁見智，睇你係為咩而讀呢個course。

reviews.author: Newstarts
reviews.title: 唔識日文千企唔好入哩科讀
reviews.comment_content:
入來哩科我相信大家都係班中意日本文化嘅啦，多數都係comics，VOCALOID d人。主要講d好basic嘅日文grammar同日常對話eg.幾多錢，你要去邊，你等陣去邊度食D乜。

但係講到Japanese culture嘅時候都幾有趣嘅，有Kyoto介紹，飲食文化，日本人中意嘅但其他人好憎嘅嘢，一年四季嘅文化 etc.

同埋開學個Beginner Declaration Sheet係假嘅，人人寫住未學過，結果成班入去得你同一兩個係真嘅唔識。
reviews.comment_teaching:
老師真係好好人，全ust最好人，對住我哋真係同一班bb仔咁。全ust最friendly嘅就係佢啦！佢話計attendance但最尾都好似冇乜用個attendance，我隔離果個考完quzi3就未再返果堂，但有事同佢講一聲就ok，除咗書面quiz，其他quiz唔得閒佢都會專登為你開另一班嘅（真係好好人啊）。

但係老師嘅教書能力同佢本人成反比，對住個本書過一次就算，問你一堆書本語錄（照住本書讀），真係慘到死。日文基礎50音兩個星期hiragana同katakana要自己背嗮，因為後邊默認你識嗮唔會再同你溫，beginner點背得嗮？用得純熟係一個星期之內？然後第一個月背嗮百幾個vocab真係衰到死。日日係度追背嘢都跟唔到mean。
reviews.comment_grading:
真係幾好對於一個誤入大佬群體嘅noob來講，三次quiz次次低過mean（唔知sd，佢未比）最尾都有B喔。

HW：
Canvas Topic Discussion：有寫都滿分啦

Writing：對住個sample照抄改d嘢隨便都滿分啦

Speaking：基本上都係16-18，但係大佬多 個音正 d vocab靚 佢哋隨隨便便都19,20，你仲諗住高過mean？

Culture Note：對住個ppt轉d詞抄埋就full mark

Quiz： 一就追得勁辛苦，或者識日文，先會輕鬆有mean以上，全部mean以上應該就B+ ~ A-

Presentation：可以日文或者英文，哩度你就知其實點解我話個BDS冇用，得我果班就2個定3個全日文係度pre3，完全聽唔明佢哋講緊d乜。但係如果有interaction or audience question基本上都係輕鬆滿分（我全英文都 full mark）

因為見到班大佬係度互片我已經唔想讀。但係都有d想其他人逼住自己去試下日文就未drop，d大佬係add and drop period都扮緊noob，一過就已經有人唔想扮嘢係度同老師用日文傾，但老師照傾（你仲唔知佢係埋beginner乜？）

我個人讀的勁hea，quiz前兩日先溫溫書，全部under mean，（換成percentage就係低10-20%左右），但係都有B
reviews.comment_workload:
第一個月：閒到不得了，得一兩份assignment好好用心機追返個gap啦如果想攞A range

第二個月：quiz來啦，一個星期至少兩份assignment，忙到半死仲要面對其他嘅midterm

第三個月：又開始閒，有的心機就快d準備pre3啦，add d日本vocab入去扮嘢最好

我個人感覺幾輕鬆嘅，可能係我cred少另加埋我得一科mid term，hea讀，前一日夜晚訓之前用半粒鐘做ddl fighter都做得完。但係我fri感覺好多嘢要讀咯，唔明佢。

reviews.author: soukai
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1-3: Hiragana & Katakana
(Memorize them)
Week 4 onwards: More and more vocabulary, self-introduction, Q&A practice
reviews.comment_teaching: Shiomi sensei teaches quite well. He does revisions on grammar when the lesson starts and gives us some tips for the quizzes, which greatly help. He is very nice so just feel free to approach him when you encounter any problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good.

Marks are given as long as you type something and share photos on discussion boards.

If you can memorize all hiragana and katakana and do some revisions on the vocabulary and grammar 1-2 days before the quizzes and final exam, you can make it to A range.

Culture Note and presentation: 11%
Culture Learning: 6%
Interactive Communication Culture: 3%
Speaking (2 assignments & 2 tests): 12%
Writing: 3%
Peer Assessment: 5%
Quiz(2 Quizzes): 40%
Final Exam: 20%
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fine, not too heavy.
Better with fewer speaking assignments.

reviews.author: ThunderDoraemon
reviews.title: Great Content but Not Good Grade Course
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches three different parts of the content. The first part is to master the Japanese characters which are Hiragana (ひらがな) and Katakana (かたかな). The second part is to learn how to read and pronounce characters in words and sentences. The third part is to learn about different Japanese cultures taught in lessons and researched by ourselves.

The study content of the course is basically from the following materials:
1. Week Notes 1-3 provided in the course (Hiragana, Katakana and Japanese words
2. Chat Chat Note Q. 1-90 (Used for Speaking Assignments, Quizzes and Final Exam)
3. Textbook "Minna no Nihongo みなのにほんご” Ch. 1-6

Overall, the content is learning basic content of Japanese languages and culture. This is interesting for me to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Shiomi Sensei is a very kind and helpful instructor to me. He often teaches us how to pronounce Japanese characters, words and sentences correctly.

Besides, Shiomi Sensei often reminds us of some common mistakes in writing Japanese characters and words. Even sometimes before different assignments and quizzes, he gives us a lot of hints to help us be confident to answer the questions correctly.

Overall, Shiomi Sensei's teaching is very good and helped me a lot in learning Japanese during the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
However, the grading is a mess.
In fact, different areas contribute to the final grade. Here are the areas:
1. Culture Notes 1&2 (3% of final grade)
2. Peer Assessment (5%)
3. Culture Canvas Topic Discussion (6%)
4. Interactive Canvas Communication Discussion (3%)
5. Culture Presentation (5%)
6. Speaking Assignments 1-4 (12%)
7. Writing Assignment (3%)
8. Quizzes 1&2 (40%)
9. Final Exam (20%)

For me:
Areas 1-4 are all full marks (17/17)
Area 5:
- Culture Presentation (4/5)
Area 6:
- Speaking 1: 19/20 (1.9/2)
- Speaking 2: 18/20 (1.8/2)
- Speaking 3: 37/40 (3.7/4)
- Speaking 4: 35/40 (3.5/4)
Area 7:
- Writing: 29/30 (2.9/30)
Area 8:
- Quiz 1: 188/200 (18.8/20)
- Quiz 2: 154/200 (15.4/20)
Area 9:
- Final Exam: 190/200 (19/20)

I got total marks of 91/100 but only get an A- grade. It means it is so competitive in this course.

Although you need to fill out the beginner declaration form at the start of the course, it does not mean people taking this course are beginners. Some of them are just going to boost their grades.

Need a lot of time to practise and attend all the classes as possible if you want to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is very heavy.

You need to finish cultures notes 1&2, culture Canvas topic discussion, interactive Canvas communication discussion, speaking assignments 1&2 and writing assignment 1 at home.

Moreover, you have to revise for the speaking assignment 3&4, quizzes 1&2 and the final exam before the dates.

And the most important thing is that you have no time to practise handwriting Hiragana and Katakana words and sentences in class.

There are blended learnings for you to practise dictation and writing at home. You must practise the handwriting of Hiragana and Katakana words and sentences at home a lot so that you can get over 160 marks on quizzes and the final exam.

Overall, if you can put a lot of effort and confidence into learning Japanese, this is a good grade course for you.

reviews.author: Ymy
reviews.title: It is better if you already know basic Japanese
reviews.comment_content:
Daily and simple sentences which cover a wide range of stuff like how to introduce yourself.
Also, he teaches a lot of vocab and Japanese cultures.

It is a very gentle course if you already know basic Japanese, especially you have N5 level. Or else, just add oil.
reviews.comment_teaching: Shiomi sensei is very nice! I love him so much, he always says some Japanese style Cantonese, so funny!! and he always interacts with us and asking us questions. He loves to encourage us, the whole class will have a cheerful atmosphere gradually.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair, if you put efforts, you will get good marks.

I guess sensei is quite free so he can always release the results just after we finished our quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite a lot
total of 10 quizzes ( almost a quiz per week), also there are 3-4 writing assignments and speaking assignments, there is also speaking test which requires you to read aloud a passage and answer some questions immediately
There are also some culture notes and discussion topic that require us to do but it is effortless.

Maybe it will be too harsh for students who have 0 knowledge about Japanese.

reviews.author: Chapmann
reviews.title: 想真正學日文自己出去比錢讀, 呢個絕對唔係beginner course。
reviews.comment_content: Culture4部分正, language果部分超難搞。教得好快，個個禮拜都要quiz (10 quizzes in total)。Quiz難度會跟住學生水平而有所提升，所以如果你係同本身識日文ge同學一班(而你係beginner)你會死得好慘。如果你跟得上會好好玩，同埋culture果部分有食物啦，唔同ge祭典啦，呢D係幾好ge。
reviews.comment_teaching:
老師好好人，呢個係真ge，上堂其實氣氛幾好，老師都好平易近人，好肯教。
不過有心同識教係兩回事，canvas D notes完全零filing，擺到好亂，上堂又教得好快。

人品: A
教學: D
所以比個C你
reviews.comment_grading: 呢部分有無得比F？無就算啦，比個E你。就如heading所講，呢個course係比讀過日文ge人讀（學校話會check但認真講句點check到吖，出去揾私人教你已經check唔到啦）D quiz難到一個點，完全唔係比beginner做，總之就讀過先好黎。
reviews.comment_workload: Workload都算多，有5份speaking 5份writing, 10個quiz, 仲有presentation同個人oral考核。

reviews.author: Sheryl
reviews.title: Enroll this course if you know Japanese
reviews.comment_content:
General Teaching: 'Minna no Nihongo' Ch1-6 (Approximately half of the content of JLPT N5 course)

Daily conversation(about 50 sentences in total)

Japanese Culture

Although there are two lessons in a week, the course is quite intensive. We use about one week to learn about Hiragana and Katakana, therefore for students who do not have a basic understanding of Japanese might find it difficult to follow on the first 2 weeks.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr. Shiomi is one of the best LANG tutor in HKUST lol.
He is passionate and funny in class. He understood there is a learning difference in class (As some of the students do not study Japanese before), he encouraged us to ask and practice more and create a lively study atmosphere.
My session is in 9AM but I do not find it boring and sleepy.
In my opinion, the most enjoyable part is to learn about Japanese culture and the vocabulary related to it.
reviews.comment_grading:
No sure about the proportion as Mr.Shiomi did not disclose the information, but I guess Final weigh the most.

4 in-class quizs (1 for basic vocabulary, the remaining 5 is about the grammer and vocabulary of textbook, 2-3 of them will have listening part as well)

Participation ( LANG course parti [cannot miss more that 5 classes])

Cultural participation (There are about 5-6 times of lesson would talk about Japanese culture, and there would be a cultural note to share what you think about the topic)

Oral Test(Questions will be about daily conversation, and would be include in a handout so you can practice and know what woud be asked, also a short speech of whatever topics you like)

1.5-5 mins Japanese Presentation (Any topic about Japan, but mainly use Japanese to present, with limited English for supplementary)

2 hours Final (Vocab+Grammar+Writing)

This is a small class (about 40 people in total), and the majority of them actually study Japanese before, so getting a good grade is quite competitive.
As there are non-Chinese enroll in this course, Mr Shiomi does not allow student to use Kanji (Japanese Chinese Characters), and I found it would be more difficult for Hong Kong students as we might adapt to learn Japanese with Kanji and might make careless mistakes in tests.

For people want to have A-Range in this class, you might need to score full marks on in-class quiz almost every time and practice a lot for oral.
reviews.comment_workload:
For students who do not have a basic background of Japanese, they need to put a lot of effort into this course as the pace is actually quite fast.

For in-class quiz, not only memorizing vocabulary,  for grammar practice, you can try for JLPT N5 exercises as they are quite similar to quiz and exams.

The most difficult one I think might be oral test and presentation, even for students who learn Japanese before, not everyone has experience to speak to a Japanese local or even give a presentation. They might be quite stressful especially for students who do not have Japanese background.

**For students who want to enroll in this course and want to have a good grade, it is very important that you learnt Japanese before lol

reviews.author: rachmaninoff
reviews.title: Pseudo-absolute grading course
reviews.comment_content: The content are mainly from "minna no nihongo 1", which is a widely used Japanese textbook for beginners. So at the start they 'teach' you the hiragana and katagana (which in fact you just need to put hard work into it and memorize everything) and then from that the instructor starts to go on with simple words, structures of sentences, and then writing short paragraphs as well as doing presentation in Japanese.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor: Koji Shiomi
Teaching is great. I bet you could never hear a single negative feedback from any of the students who took the course. Shiomi sensei is super passionate (as you might expect from a Japanese instructor) about teaching and he is pure class, absolutely amazing.
reviews.comment_grading:
They claim to be deploying an absolute grading system but I can assure you that it's not. Main reason is that:
1) most people who took the class already knew japanese beforehand
2) that leads to the instructor thinking that the quiz is too easy and they adjust the difficulty to an unbelievably monster level (which those freaking people stil managed to score a full mark for that) and that, would eventually made you perform worse. Those people who knew Japanese beforehand could complete the quiz in a blink of eye, and you would be like sitting there for 1 hour and you still cant figure out what was going on with the quiz.

Carefully consider whether you want to take this if you have no background in Japanese. Unless it's an must (like GBUS foreign language requirement, but still my adivce is, you'd better take other foreign language courses) or you dont care about the grade, then just go ahead. The instructor is amazing tho.
reviews.comment_workload: It really depends on how fast one could pick up a language and somehow you have to be quite hardworking to catch up with what has been taught during the last week. There are 4 quizzes, which are evenly spread over the semester, so you would probably expect a quiz coming to you every 2.5 week (meaning that you need to understand and recite everything beforehand to take the quiz). Apart from quizzes you also got to do a 1 to 2 min. presentation in Japanese on a cultural topic at the end of the course. Of course you also got a final exam to complete.

reviews.author: hoah
reviews.comment_content: Mainly use notes provided by the instructor and textbook "大家の日本語”. The first few lessons were taught about hiragana and katakana. The remaining lessons covered simple conversation in Japanese and Japanese culture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Shiomi Sensee is very very nice. During the lesson, he told us many jokes and his own stories.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite nice. However, some students may learn basic Japanese before enrolling in this course. It requires effort to get a good grade if you have never learnt Japanese before.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy, including 4 canvas discussions, 5 speaking exercises, 3 writing exercises, 4 culture notes, a cultural presentation, 3 quizzes and final exam

reviews.author: baskingball10
reviews.title: a beginners course that's not for absolute beginners
reviews.comment_content:
mainly learning about hiragana and katakana, simple daily sentences, and ways to introduce yourself in japanese. a lot of vocab words, as well as teaching some cultural aspects of japan.

equivalent to the lower half of japanese n5 level.
reviews.comment_teaching:
mr shiomi is probably the nicest professor in the whole of ust. his classes are super lighthearted, super energetic, never gets remotely angry, and even out of class he is super willing to help students on different questions that they may have regarding an assignment or quiz.

in terms of teaching content, he breezes through the course content, like super super quickly. we could be done with a chapter of content in like a week. this is probably mainly influenced by the crazy amount of smurfs there are in his classes, which basically reassures him that the whole class knows the content already (which if you dont know japanese beforehand, you dont.) to catch up with content, you'll basically have to spend time out of class to actually be on the same level as other people, simply due to the insane amount of vocab there is in each chapter.
reviews.comment_grading:
in class quizzes 4x
attendance
homework
cultural discussion in class
peer review
cultural presentation
oral exam
final exam -- 2hr

final grade: 95%/A

as a person with no japanese background, i had to basically incorporate japanese into my study schedule every day just to get to this level. grading is extremely skewed up by smurfs so if youre looking for an easy grade course and you dont know any japanese, stay away. its only possible to get good grades in this course if you work really hard for it, harder than it shouldve ever been.
reviews.comment_workload:
pretty much 1 quiz per week which i find is fair, around 4 or 5 writing assignments and a few speaking assignments/tests, which is all for tne better if you want a decent chance against all the smurfs who take this course as a grade booster lol
there are also assignments on culture of japan and stuff, but those are written in english and is pretty easy with maybe 10-15 mins of research

reviews.author: sleepingzzz
reviews.comment_content: 老師自己整嘅ppt同《大家的日本語》Ch1-6，會教50音、日常對話同vocab，仲會有少少日本文化咁。
reviews.comment_teaching: 老師好好人好親切，feel到佢好熱心，上堂氣氛都好輕鬆好舒服。雖然好鍾意shiomi sensei，不過都要承認佢教得快，一開始日文最基本嘅50音都只係用咗好少時間講。
reviews.comment_grading:
入面好多人都有D日文底，所以quiz嘅分數/mean都會比較高。不過最後我同我個frd個grade都唔錯。

另外上堂會take attendance，不過唔肯定計唔計分。
reviews.comment_workload:
會有quiz、canvas discussion、speaking同final（canvas discussion基本上有做就滿分）
因為教得比較快，所以如果真係beginner嘅就要花多D時間去追（建議最好識50音，如果識咗50音就冇咩大問題）

reviews.author: Frankie2003
reviews.title: DON'T JOIN THIS COURSE IF YOU HAVEN'T STUDY JAPANESE BEFORE!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
As other review had talk about the content with many detail, I won't repeat it again. While if long story short, you can learn some basic Japanese and Japanese culture in this course.

However, as most of your classmate have such a knowledge, so if you want to learn Japanese by this course, then I will suggest you don't joining this course as it is hard for you to learn Japanese within one semester.

Actually, I join this course for having good grade to help me in major selection and I think many people have learn Japanese before join this course by the same reason.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Shiomi sensei was a very good teacher, very kind and he will makes you enjoy the lesson. While it is hard for you to follow his lesson as most of the classmates know Japanese, they will answer the question on the slide very fast and correctly, for those who haven't learn Japanese before you may think that the slide go very fast before you understand the content of it.(like how to read such a word)

Overall, Shiomi sensei is the best teacher in UST but it is hard to learn some content from him.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't think grading is really good as it depends on you have the basic knowledge of Japanese or not. For me I have some basic knowledge, so I get A. However, if you don't have it then you maybe get B or even below it. While it is hard for you to get C in this course, so it should be good grade I think.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I said if you don't have some basic knowledge of Japanese then it is a very hard course for you.As most of your classmate know Japanese, it is hard for you to above the mean of the quiz.Also the content of the quiz will become harder and harder due to your classmate always get full marks, so you need to spend more and more time on it.

While if you know Japanese then it is easy, very low workload and even you don't attend the lesson you can get full marks.(while you need to take attendance so you must go to the lecture)

reviews.author: hihi626
reviews.title: Very good course
reviews.comment_content:
Just very basic Japanese. mostly daily life words. covered the content of the first six chapter of みんなの日本語.
Forgot which one, I think is the most basic one tho.
Nothing much to talk about.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good teacher. Very friendly to all of us, Shiomi sensei shared many things in Japan with us. Fun lesson in general.
And he tried to give us as high marks as possible, so good marks , good teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just do all the homework and study for all the quizzes.
You almost always get a good mark if you finished the homework.
While you really need to pay attention in class to score high in the quizzes, cuz many questions about Japan is asked in those quizzes, which are not in the textbooks.
I got an A- overall so it is good I guess.
reviews.comment_workload: It may be quite hard for those who have never learnt Japanese before. You need to be familiar with all the Japanese alphabets in a short time in order to understand things more easier in class. That's really the hardest part. The homework are quite easy, most of them only take a 10 to 15 min to complete and get a full mark. Just go to every lesson and study before the quizzes and the speaking tests.
